intro: Eulophia articulata, commonly known as the jointed eulophia, is a terrestrial orchid native to tropical regions of Africa and Asia. It features a sympodial growth habit with a rhizome that produces a cluster of leaves and a flowering stem. The plant has linear, grass-like leaves and produces inflorescences with showy, fragrant flowers in shades of white, yellow, and green. Its flowers are typically spurred and have a distinctive, intricate structure typical of the Orchidaceae family. Eulophia articulata is often found in moist, shaded habitats such as forests and along stream banks.
